deployedGeneratedSources.name: #utility.yul

documentation.text:
@notice DevToken is a development token that we use to learn how to code solidity 
 and what BEP-20 interface requires
@notice Our Tokens required variables that are needed to operate everything

@notice _balances is a mapping that contains a address as KEY 
 and the balance of the address as the value

@notice Events are created below.
 Transfer event is a event that notify the blockchain that a transfer of assets has taken place

@notice constructor will be triggered when we create the Smart contract
 _name = name of the token
 _short_symbol = Short Symbol name for the token
 token_decimals = The decimal precision of the Token, defaults 18
 _totalSupply is how much Tokens there are totally
@notice decimals will return the number of decimal precision the Token is deployed with
@notice symbol will return the Token's symbol
@notice name will return the Token's symbol
@notice totalSupply will return the tokens total supply of tokens
@notice balanceOf will return the account balance for the given account

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "DevToken: cannot mint to zero address"

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "DevToken: Cannot burn more than the account owns"

arguments.value: DevToken: Cannot burn more than the account owns

documentation.text:
@notice burn will destroy tokens from an address inputted and then decrease total supply
 An Transfer event will emit with receiever set to zero address
 
 Requires 
 - Account cannot be zero
 - Account balance has to be bigger or equal to amount

Transfer(address,address,uint256).notice: Events are created below. Transfer event is a event that notify the blockchain that a transfer of assets has taken place

balanceOf(address).notice: balanceOf will return the account balance for the given account

burn(address,uint256).notice: burn will destroy tokens from an address inputted and then decrease total supply An Transfer event will emit with receiever set to zero address  Requires  - Account cannot be zero - Account balance has to be bigger or equal to amount

constructor.notice: constructor will be triggered when we create the Smart contract _name = name of the token _short_symbol = Short Symbol name for the token token_decimals = The decimal precision of the Token, defaults 18 _totalSupply is how much Tokens there are totally

decimals().notice: decimals will return the number of decimal precision the Token is deployed with

mint(address,uint256).notice: mint will create tokens on the address inputted and then increase the total supply It will also emit an Transfer event, with sender set to zero address (adress(0))  Requires that the address that is recieveing the tokens is not zero address

name().notice: name will return the Token's symbol

symbol().notice: symbol will return the Token's symbol

totalSupply().notice: totalSupply will return the tokens total supply of tokens

userdoc.notice: DevToken is a development token that we use to learn how to code solidity  and what BEP-20 interface requires
